Name: Boeing
Description: Boeing is a leading aerospace company that designs, manufactures, and sells airplanes, rotorcraft, rockets, satellites, and telecommunications equipment worldwide.

Name: Douglas Aircraft Company
Description: Douglas Aircraft Company was a major American manufacturer of military and civilian aircraft, known for its innovative designs and engineering excellence.

Name: Lockheed Corporation
Description: Lockheed Martin is a global aerospace, defense, and security company, formed through the merger of Lockheed Corporation and Martin Marietta.

Name: North American Aviation
Description: North American Aviation was a major American aircraft manufacturer known for producing World War II fighters like the P-51 Mustang and the F-86 Sabre.

Name: Grumman Aircraft Engineering Corporation
Description: Grumman was an American aerospace company that gained fame for its military aircraft, particularly the F-14 Tomcat and the G-44 Widgeon.

Name: Curtiss-Wright Corporation
Description: Curtiss-Wright is a global company involved in aerospace and defense, known for producing aircraft engines and military aircraft.

Name: Fairchild Aircraft
Description: Fairchild Aircraft was known for its innovative designs in both military and civil aviation, producing aircraft like the Fairchild C-119 Flying Boxcar.

Name: Convair (Consolidated Vultee Aircraft Corporation)
Description: Convair was an American aerospace manufacturer, famous for its Convair 880 and 990 jetliners, as well as the B-36 Peacemaker bomber.

Name: Hawker Aircraft
Description: Hawker Aircraft was a British manufacturer known for its fighter aircraft, including the Hawker Hurricane, which played a vital role in WWII.

Name: Supermarine
Description: Supermarine is best known for the iconic Spitfire, a British fighter aircraft that was a key asset for the Royal Air Force during WWII.

Name: Avro
Description: Avro was a British aircraft manufacturer known for producing the Avro Lancaster bomber and the Avro Vulcan strategic bomber.

Name: Vickers-Armstrongs
Description: Vickers-Armstrongs was known for a variety of military aircraft, including the Vickers Wellington and Vickers Viscount airliner.

Name: De Havilland
Description: De Havilland was a British aircraft manufacturer famous for the DH.98 Mosquito, a versatile aircraft used in WWII, and the Comet, the first commercial jet airliner.

Name: Bristol Aeroplane Company
Description: Bristol Aeroplane Company was known for its innovative aircraft designs, including the Bristol Blenheim bomber and the Bristol Britannia airliner.

Name: Fokker
Description: Fokker was a Dutch aviation company famous for its aircraft in WWI and later commercial aircraft, like the Fokker 100.

Name: Messerschmitt AG
Description: Messerschmitt AG was a German aircraft manufacturer known for the Bf 109 and Me 262, which were pivotal in WWII.

Name: Junkers
Description: Junkers was a pioneer in all-metal aircraft design, producing the famous Junkers Ju 52 transport aircraft and several military models.

Name: Heinkel
Description: Heinkel was a significant German aircraft manufacturer, known for the He 111 bomber and the He 162 Volksjäger jet.

Name: Fiat Aviazione
Description: Fiat Aviazione was an Italian aircraft manufacturer known for its military aircraft, including the CR.42 Falco fighter.

Name: Caproni
Description: Caproni was an Italian aircraft manufacturer known for its innovative designs and contributions to both military and commercial aviation.

Name: Savoia-Marchetti
Description: Savoia-Marchetti was known for its civil and military aircraft, including the S.55 flying boat and the SM.79 bomber.

Name: Piaggio Aero
Description: Piaggio Aero has been involved in aircraft design and manufacturing, producing notable models such as the Piaggio P.180 Avanti.

Name: Macchi
Description: Macchi was an Italian aircraft manufacturer best known for its WWII fighters, such as the MC.205 Veltro.

Name: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries
Description: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries is a major Japanese corporation involved in the aerospace sector, known for producing military and commercial aircraft.

Name: Nakajima Aircraft Company
Description: Nakajima was a prominent Japanese aircraft manufacturer known for its fighters during WWII, such as the Ki-43 Oscar.

Name: Kawanishi Aircraft Company
Description: Kawanishi was known for its flying boats, particularly the H6K and H8K models, used by the Imperial Japanese Navy.

Name: Aérospatiale
Description: Aérospatiale was a French state-owned aerospace manufacturer involved in the design and production of aircraft, rockets, and satellites.

Name: Sud Aviation
Description: Sud Aviation was a French aerospace manufacturer known for the Caravelle jetliner and its involvement in the Airbus consortium.

Name: Farman Aviation Works
Description: Farman Aviation Works was known for its pioneering role in early aviation and producing both military and civilian aircraft.

Name: Dassault Aviation
Description: Dassault Aviation is a French aerospace company known for its military and business jets, including the Mirage and Falcon series.

Name: Breguet Aviation
Description: Breguet Aviation was known for producing innovative aircraft designs and contributed to both military and civilian aviation.

Name: Handley Page
Description: Handley Page was a British aircraft manufacturer noted for its bombers in WWI and WWII, including the HP.42 and Halifax.

Name: Short Brothers
Description: Short Brothers was known for its flying boats and later produced the Short Belfast, a heavy transport aircraft.

Name: Saab
Description: Saab is a Swedish aerospace and defense company known for its fighter aircraft, including the JAS 39 Gripen.

Name: Ilyushin
Description: Ilyushin is a Russian aircraft manufacturer known for its strategic bombers and transport aircraft, such as the Il-76.

Name: Tupolev
Description: Tupolev is a prominent Russian aircraft manufacturer known for its bombers, notably the Tu-95 and the Tu-154 airliner.

Name: Yakovlev
Description: Yakovlev is known for producing military aircraft, especially fighters like the Yak-3 and Yak-9 during WWII.

Name: Antonov
Description: Antonov is a Ukrainian aircraft manufacturer known for producing large transport aircraft, including the An-225 Mriya.

Name: Aero Vodochody
Description: Aero Vodochody is a Czech aircraft manufacturer specializing in military aircraft and training jets, such as the L-39 Albatros.

Name: Avia
Description: Avia is known for its fighter aircraft and has a rich history in Czechoslovak aviation, producing models like the Avia B-534.

Name: Letov
Description: Letov was a Czech aircraft manufacturer known for its innovative designs and military aircraft during both World Wars.

Name: Embraer
Description: Embraer is a Brazilian aerospace company known for producing regional jets and military aircraft, including the Embraer EMB 120 and A-29 Super Tucano.
